# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_words = []
    for word in words
        if length(unwrap(wrapped_words)) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(wrapped_words, "\n")
        end
        push!(wrapped_words, word)
    end
    joined = join(wrapped_words)
    return joined
end

text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consetetur sadipscing elitr sed diam
nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam"
println(wrap_string(text, text_width=20))
```

This script takes a string and splits it into words and prints out these words on a new line whenever the total length of the wrapped words exceeds the specified text width.
